name: CreateFeatureFlagBlastRadius
description:
Create a feature flag blast radius for a project.

This tool creates a user blast radius for feature flags within a specified project. It can be used to manage the scope of feature flag exposure to users. Refer to the documentation for more details on managing feature flags.

parameters.name: feature_flag_project_id
parameters.description: The Project ID for accessing the desired project. Obtainable via the /api/projects/ endpoint.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: feature_flag_blast_radius_details
parameters.description: JSON object defining the configuration details for creating a feature flag blast radius. Includes fields like 'name', 'key', 'active', 'rollout_percentage', and more to customize the flag's behavior and scope.

name.description: contains the description for the flag (field name `name` is kept for backwards-compatibility)

user_access_level.description: The effective access level the user has for this object

creation_context.description:
Indicates the origin product of the feature flag. Choices: 'feature_flags', 'experiments', 'surveys', 'early_access_features', 'web_experiments'.

* `feature_flags` - feature_flags
* `experiments` - experiments
* `surveys` - surveys
* `early_access_features` - early_access_features
* `web_experiments` - web_experiments

evaluation_runtime.description:
Specifies where this feature flag should be evaluated

* `server` - Server
* `client` - Client
* `all` - All

last_called_at.description: Last time this feature flag was called (from $feature_flag_called events)

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.
